page.title: 12TOURISM in RHAYADER
page.content: Tourism generates a large amount of employment particularly in the summer months when many visitors arrive in the town.Many people visit the area to see the Elan Valley resevoirs which were built by Birmingham Corporation at the end of the 19th century.This tourism helped to offset the decline in local industry.The rise of the tourist industry led to Rhayader be- coming a "resort"with shops being open on Sundays and Bank Holidays. Since 1970's there have been more foreign tourists in evidence.The other main attraction is pony-trekking with many people staying in the town for trek- king holidays.There is also a caravan and camping site situated on the banks of the River Wye which attracts many visitors.Fishing, canoeeing and,more recently,hang-gliding are the other main attractions.
